sentences.sContent: Teenagers and their parents rarely agree.
sentences.sCn: 十几岁的孩子跟父母意见很少一致。

sentences.sContent: ...Some team members find it hard to agree on questions like membership and the team’s purpose...
...Most professors agree whether to give an in-class or a take-home exam depends on type of course being taught...
...I must say I agree with you about there being bad feelings in the works...
...Why do the 4-H girls agree to follow the park project through to completion...
...but they also agree that the rapid increase in price is eating up more and more of the potential return...
...Female economists agree with men that Europe has too much regulation and that Wal-mart is good for society...
...We all seem to agree that a college education is wonderful...
...Experts tend to agree that for the average student...

phrases.pCn: 在…方面意见一致；在…相同
对…有相同的看法；就…取得一致意见
消除分歧，求同存异；同意各自保留不同意见
在某一点上取得一致意见

trans.tranOther: to have or express the same opinion about something as someone else
